citations.desc: Institutional Animal Care and Use Committee (IACUC)
citations.narrative:
The principal investigator for protocol 0008 was involved in the IACUC deliberations involving the protocol. No member of
the IACUC shall be involved in the deliberations or vote on any protocol in which they have a conflicting interest as they
are personally involved in the activity except to provide information as requested by the Committee. This is essential to
ensure that the IACUC not be unduly influenced by the principal investigator during deliberations on the protocol.
Correct by: 6/14/2024

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
There were multiple expired drugs found at the facility. Cefilex injection 100 mls. expired 7/2022. Two 50 mls. vials
heparin injection expired 8/2021. Super B injection 100 mls. expired 2/2024. Vitamin C injection 100 mls. vial expired
1/2024. 50% dextrose injection 500 mls. expired 8/2017. The use of expired medications is not appropriate for treating
swine. These medications may not be effective and, in the case of medications that expired years ago, they might be
contaminated. Use of these medications could cause harm to the animals that are intended to be treated with them.
Discontinue use of expired medications for treatment of swine.
Correct by: 6/14/2024

citations.desc: Attending veterinarian and adequate veterinary care.
citations.narrative:
Approximately 25% of the 72 swine that were inspected had overgrown hooves. Overgrown hooves can lead to joint
issues and discomfort for these swine. A more effective hoof trimming program must be established by the facility to
ensure that swine toes are appropriately trimmed as needed.
Correct by: 6/21/2024

There are no meeting minutes completed for IACUC protocol review meetings. It is required that minutes be generated for
all IACUC meetings including,- records of proposed activities involving animals and proposed significant changes in
activities involving animals and whether IACUC approval was given or withheld. This information is essential for APHIS
inspectors to evaluate the actions of the IACUC and to determine that animals are being used in a humane and judicious
manner by the facility. Complete meeting minutes for all convened IACUC meetings.
Correct by: Correct by: 6/14/2024
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with a facility representative.
Additional Inspectors:
Michael Schnell, Supervisory Animal Care Specialist n
